Problem:

We run simulations using an initial condition \\( \\psi_0(x) \\) modified by a function \\( f(\\psi) = e^{iKx}\\psi \\), with \\( K \\) representing a constant wave number.

If \\( f(\\psi) \\) is applied to \\( \\psi_0 \\) and then allowed to evolve according to the Schrödinger equation without further intervention, will \\( \\psi(x, T) \\) at time T be the same as if \\( \\psi_0 \\) was directly evolved to time T under the Schrödinger equation?
Explanation: Applying \\( f(\\psi) \\) initially modifies the wave function by introducing a phase shift depending on \\( x \\). This initial condition change results in a different wave function evolution under the Schrödinger equation, altering the outcome at time T.
